program.name: python -m ep_bolfi.kadi_tools.fit_and_plot_ocv
program.description: Please refer to the --help output of this file.

param.description: Persistent record identifier where the input data is stored.
param.name: input-record

param.description: File name.
param.name: filename

param.description: Persistent record identifier where the results get stored.
param.name: output-record

param.description: Title of the plot. Defaults to the file name.
param.name: title

param.description: Format of generated image file.
param.name: format

param.description: Key in the json dictionary for the SOC values.
param.name: soc-key

param.description: Key in the json dictionary for the OCV values.
param.name: ocv-key

param.description: Number of phases of the OCV model. More are more accurate.
param.name: phases

param.description: The charge number of the electrode interface reaction.
param.name: charge-number

param.description: Temperature at which the OCV got measured.
param.name: temperature

param.description: 2-tuple giving the lower maximum and upper minimum SOC range to be considered in the automatic data SOC range determination.
param.name: soc-range-bounds

param.description: Optional hard lower and upper bounds for the SOC correction from the left and the right side, respectively, as a 2-tuple. Use it if you know that your OCV data is incomplete and by how much. Has to be inside (0.0, 1.0). Set to (0.0, 1.0) to allow the SOC range estimation to assign datapoints to the asymptotes.
param.name: soc-range-limits

param.description: Set this to 'Positive' or 'Negative' to apply the fitted SOC range on the data and assign the result to one of the two electrodes.
param.name: assign-fitted-soc-to

param.description: Set to True if assigned SOCs shall go in the other direction. 'soc-range' arguments always work as if this was set to False. Flips the SOCs by subtracting them from 1.
param.name: flip-soc-convention

param.description: 2-tuple giving the SOC range in which the SOC(OCV) model function gets inverted by a smoothing spline interpolation.
param.name: spline-soc-range

param.description: Order of the aforementioned smoothing spline. Setting it to 0 only fits and plots the OCV model.
param.name: spline-order

param.description: If set to either 'python' or 'matlab', a string representation of the smoothing spline gets appended to the results file.
param.name: spline-print

param.description: If True, the x-axis gets rescaled to match the asymptotes of the OCV fit function at 0 and 1.
param.name: normalized-xaxis

param.description: The order of the norm of the vector of the distances between OCV data and OCV model. Default is 2, i.e., the Euclidean norm. 1 sets it to absolute distance, and float('inf') sets it to maximum distance.
param.name: distance-order

param.description: Dictionary that gets passed to scipy.optimize.minimize with the method 'trust-constr'. See scipy.optimize.show_options with the arguments 'minimize' and 'trust-constr' for details.
param.name: minimize-options

param.description: Whether or not an already existing file by the same name in the record gets overwritten.
param.name: overwrite

param.description: Toggle to display the plot on the machine this script runs on.
param.name: display
